intro: Persoonia virgata var. lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ghostpipe shrub, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and distinctive, pale green or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowers are often clustered in dense inflorescences and are pollinated by insects. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
